Recommendations: 1. The Department of Nursing should adhere with the guidelines defined by the University Manual of Operations in Extension.

2. The designed extension program and projects should be base don needs and problems of the adopted communities. A research of the needs and problems of the adopted communities should be undertaken. Results of the research shouid be used as baseline information for designing the program and projects.

3. Regular monitoring and evaluation of extension projects should be undertaken continuously. A system of monitoring and evaluation may be designed. Appropriate instruments for monitoring and evaluation may also be developed.
4. More faculty members of the Department of Nursing should actively participate in its extension and community involvement projects and other related activities.
5. Adopted communities should be encouraged to participate actively in the planning, implementation, and evaluation of extension projects.
6. The Department of Nursing should make efforts to generate additional funds for its extension program and projects.
7. Wider dissemination of its extension program and projects should be made.
8. A systematic and continuous documentation of the extension program projects and other related activities should be pursued vigorously.
